current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To increase access to refinancing for homeowners, and for
		  other purposes.

has not been more

text.#text:
Each
			 enterprise shall establish and carry out a program under this section to
			 provide for the refinancing of eligible mortgages.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an enterprise may purchase, guarantee, service, sell, lend on
			 the security of, refinance, or otherwise deal in eligible mortgages.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding
			 any provision of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in carrying out the refinancing program required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, each enterprise may prescribe
			 any requirements, terms, and conditions that such enterprise determines
			 necessary to carry out the refinancing program required under

,
			 including with respect to any underwriting criteria, such as—

text.#text: Subject to

verification of a
			 borrower’s employment, income, reserves, and assets;

a borrower’s
			 credit history;

property
			 valuation requirements;

representations
			 and warranties;

eligible property
			 type and occupancy requirements; and

continuation of
			 the second-lien position, or release, of any junior liens on the
			 property.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an eligible mortgage with
			 existing credit enhancement coverage must continue to maintain or otherwise
			 transfer such coverage to the new mortgage that is a result of the refinancing
			 of the eligible mortgage authorized by this section.

text.#text:
In order to participate in the
			 refinancing program required under

header.#text:
Existing credit
			 enhancements to be retained

text.#text:
The term of any new mortgage that is a result of
			 the refinancing of an eligible mortgage authorized by this section shall not
			 exceed 30 years.

header.#text:
Maximum term of
			 the new mortgage

text.#text:
The maximum original principal obligation of any new
			 mortgage that is a result of the refinancing of an eligible mortgage authorized
			 by this section shall not exceed the limitation in law governing the maximum
			 original principal obligation on conventional mortgages that may be purchased
			 or guaranteed by an enterprise, as such law is in effect on the date of the
			 closing of the new mortgage.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may issue any regulations, guidance, or directives necessary to carry
			 out the refinancing program required under

text.#text: The

Each enterprise shall charge a guarantee
			 fee in connection with any guarantee of the timely payment of principal and
			 interest on securities, notes, and other obligations based on or backed by
			 eligible mortgages refinanced under this Act.

header.#text:
Requirement To
			 charge a guarantee fee

to cover the expected risk of default on the pool of eligible
			 mortgages refinanced under this Act backing the security, note, or other
			 obligation to which the enterprises' guarantee applies.

to mortgage originators, borrowers, and investors by decreasing other charges,

text.#text: The

shall prohibit an
			 enterprise from consummating any offer for a guarantee on any security, note,
			 or other obligation based on or backed by eligible mortgages refinanced under
			 this Act, if the guarantee is inconsistent with the requirements of this
			 section.
